verses.esv: 28 You shall not make any cuts on your body for the dead or tattoo yourselves: I am the LORD.
verses.kjv: 28 Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you: I am the LORD.
verses.niv: 28 "'Do not cut your bodies for the dead or put tattoo marks on yourselves. I am the LORD.

verses.esv: 19 Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit within you, whom you have from God? You are not your own, 20 for you were bought with a price. So glorify God in your body.
verses.kjv: 19 What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost which is in you, which ye have of God, and ye are not your own? 20 For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God’s.
verses.niv: 19 Do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own; 20 you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your body.

verses.esv: 9 likewise also that women should adorn themselves in respectable apparel, with modesty and self-control, not with braided hair and gold or pearls or costly attire,
verses.kjv: 9 In like manner also, that women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with shamefacedness and sobriety; not with broided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly array;
verses.niv: 9 I also want women to dress modestly, with decency and propriety, not with braided hair or gold or pearls or expensive clothes,

verses.esv: 15 by abolishing the law of commandments expressed in ordinances, that he might create in himself one new man in place of the two, so making peace,
verses.kjv: 15 Having abolished in his flesh the enmity, even the law of commandments contained in ordinances; for to make in himself of twain one new man, so making peace;
verses.niv: 15 by abolishing in his flesh the law with its commandments and regulations. His purpose was to create in himself one new man out of the two, thus making peace,

verses.esv: 31 So, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.
verses.kjv: 31 Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.
verses.niv: 31 So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God.

verses.esv: 23 Now before faith came, we were held captive under the law, imprisoned until the coming faith would be revealed. 24 So then, the law was our guardian until Christ came, in order that we might be justified by faith. 25 But now that faith has come, we are no longer under a guardian,
verses.kjv: 23 But before faith came, we were kept under the law, shut up unto the faith which should afterwards be revealed. 24 Wherefore the law was our schoolmaster to bring us unto Christ, that we might be justified by faith. 25 But after that faith is come, we are no longer under a schoolmaster.
verses.niv: 23 Before this faith came, we were held prisoners by the law, locked up until faith should be revealed. 24 So the law was put in charge to lead us to Christ that we might be justified by faith. 25 Now that faith has come, we are no longer under the supervision of the law.

verses.esv: 4 For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.
verses.kjv: 4 For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believeth.
verses.niv: 4 Christ is the end of the law so that there may be righteousness for everyone who believes.

verses.esv: 24 Therefore God gave them up in the lusts of their hearts to impurity, to the dishonoring of their bodies among themselves,
verses.kjv: 24 Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:
verses.niv: 24 Therefore God gave them over in the sinful desires of their hearts to sexual impurity for the degrading of their bodies with one another.

verses.esv: 14:1 “You are the sons of the LORD your God. You shall not cut yourselves or make any baldness on your foreheads for the dead.
verses.kjv: 1 Ye are the children of the LORD your God: ye shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead.
verses.niv: 1 You are the children of the LORD your God. Do not cut yourselves or shave the front of your heads for the dead,

verses.esv: 17 then you shall take an awl, and put it through his ear into the door, and he shall be your slave forever. And to your female slave you shall do the same.
verses.kjv: 17 Then thou shalt take an aul, and thrust it through his ear unto the door, and he shall be thy servant for ever. And also unto thy maidservant thou shalt do likewise.
verses.niv: 17 then take an awl and push it through his ear lobe into the door, and he will become your servant for life. Do the same for your maidservant.

verses.esv: 6 then his master shall bring him to God, and he shall bring him to the door or the doorpost. And his master shall bore his ear through with an awl, and he shall be his slave forever.
verses.kjv: 6 Then his master shall bring him unto the judges; he shall also bring him to the door, or unto the door post; and his master shall bore his ear through with an aul; and he shall serve him for ever.
verses.niv: 6 then his master must take him before the judges. He shall take him to the door or the doorpost and pierce his ear with an awl. Then he will be his servant for life.

verses.esv: 19 Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit within you, whom you have from God? You are not your own,
verses.kjv: 19 What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost which is in you, which ye have of God, and ye are not your own?
verses.niv: 19 Do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own;

verses.esv: 16 Do you not know that you are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit dwells in you?
verses.kjv: 16 Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?
verses.niv: 16 Don't you know that you yourselves are God's temple and that God's Spirit lives in you?

verses.esv: 13 “Food is meant for the stomach and the stomach for food”—and God will destroy both one and the other. The body is not meant for sexual immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.
verses.kjv: 13 Meats for the belly, and the belly for meats: but God shall destroy both it and them. Now the body is not for fornication, but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body.
verses.niv: 13 "Food for the stomach and the stomach for food"--but God will destroy them both. The body is not meant for sexual immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.

verses.esv: 23 But whoever has doubts is condemned if he eats, because the eating is not from faith. For whatever does not proceed from faith is sin.
verses.kjv: 23 And he that doubteth is damned if he eat, because he eateth not of faith: for whatsoever is not of faith is sin.
verses.niv: 23 But the man who has doubts is condemned if he eats, because his eating is not from faith; and everything that does not come from faith is sin.
